In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure! Here is an implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_string)
    current_line_length = 0
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        
        result *= " $word"
        current_line_length += length(word) + 1
    end
    
    return result
end
```

Here is an example of how you can use the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
input_text = "This is an example of a long sentence that needs to be wrapped"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(input_text, text_width=15)

println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output:

```
 This is an
 example of a
 long sentence
 that needs to
 be wrapped
```
